{{book | title=Tolkien Diary 2001 | image = Tolkien Diary 2001.jpg | illustrator=[[John Howe]] | publisher=[[HarperCollins]] | date=[[5 June]] [[2000]] | format= | pages=120 | isbn=978-0261104020 | precededby=[[Tolkien Diary 2000]] | followedby=[[Tolkien Diary 2002]] }} '''''The Tolkien Diary 2001''''' was a blank diary book featuring illustrations by [[John Howe]]. ==From the publisher== {{blockquote|A desk diary for the year 2001, containing original paintings based on The Lord of the Rings.

This sumptuous week-to-view desk diary is illustrated with 13 brand new paintings from John Howe, creator of the famous ‘Gandalf’ jacket and designer on the forthcoming Lord of the Rings Movie Trilogy . The paintings are all based on Tolkien’s classic masterpiece, The Lord of the Rings and the overall design of this year’s calendar features input from the artist himself.}} ==See also== *''[[Tolkien Calendar 2001]]'' {{title|italic}} [[Category:Diaries]] [[Category:Publications by title]]
